--- In j=
unit@yahoogroups.com, "cant_jim" <jimcant@...> wrote:
>
> I assume these re=
ports are in files. Couldn't you just 'diff' them (assuming your on a nice =
*nix system; I guess on Windows you need to resort to WinDiff) or is there =
something I don't understand about the problem
>    diff -bw ReportA Report=
B 
> should do the trick.  You'll get differences between them if the runni=
ng times of tests are different but the serious differences should be obvio=
us.
> 
> Are you going to asses the differences visually or is this going t=
o be in a script; if the latter, the problem is more interesting (i.e. hard=
er).
> 
> Hope this helps
> 
> jim
> 
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "rohi=
tkulkarni15" <rohitkulkarni15@> wrote:
> >
> > Hi,
> > 
> > Currently, I ha=
ve a requirement of comparing results of two JUnit reports(with same set of=
 tests).
> > The result of this comparison activity should be to generate a=
 diff report that mentions only those tests whose status is different as co=
mpared to the 1st result
> > 
> > i.e. If i have report A and report B, how=
 to get the list of differences between these two reports.
> > 
> > Can som=
eone please guide me on how to do this?
> > 
> > Thanks,
> > Rohit
> >
>
